date.headline: Jobs gets wish in 'thermonuclear war,' at least for now
date.text: Steve Jobs has won the first battle of his self-declared "thermonuclear war" against Google's Android OS.

date.text: Steve Jobs has won the first battle of his self-declared "thermonuclear war" against Google's Android OS. Originally posted at The Social Analyst

date.headline: Thai Buddhist Temple: Steve Jobs Now a 'Mid-Level Angel'
date.text: The late Steve Jobs is now living in a 'parallel universe' as a 'mid-level angel,' a Thai Buddhist temple claims.

date.headline: Steve Jobs promise leads to lawsuit
date.text: Steve Jobs promised Wayne Goodrich that he would always have a job. read more

date.headline: ‘jOBS’ Set Photos: Ashton Kutcher as Apple CEO Steve Jobs
date.text: Photos from the set of the Steve Jobs biopic, 'jOBS', have appeared online which show how closely star Ashton Kutcher resembles the late Apple CEO.

date.headline: Apparently Steve Jobs Is Now Half a Yak And Lives In A Silver And Crystal Castle
date.text: It can be somewhat difficult to entirely parse the meanings of those religions with which one is not familiar. But it would appear that one Thai Buddhist sect has decided, nay declared, that Steve Jobs is now half of a yak inhabiting a crystal and silver castle in the afterlife. After Mr. Steve Jobs has passed away, he reincarnated as a divine being (?) encompassing his characteristics: a person ...

date.headline: Thai Buddhists say Steve Jobs reincarnated as a mid-level angel dwelling in parallel world
date.text: Steve Jobs is living in a big heavenly palace, the height of a six-storey building...

date.headline: Suspect in burglary of Steve Jobs' home in court
date.text: Suspect in burglary of Steve Jobs' home in court Suspect in burglary of Steve Jobs' home in court (AP) — A man accused of breaking into Steve Jobs' house and stealing computers along with the Apple Inc. co-founder's wallet has hired a new private attorney.

date.headline: Slide Show: Apple in the year since Jobs resigned
date.text: Steve Jobs resigned as Apple’s CEO on Aug. 24, 2011, and died just six weeks later. But in the year since his resignation, the company he co-founded has flourished as never before.

date.headline: Steve Perlman remains OnLive CEO in company rebirth
date.text: OnLive CEO Steve Perlman is retaining his position as chief operating officer of the cloud gaming service, despite over half of his employees losing their jobs when the company shut down. OnLive amassed debts of over $30 million , but was acquired by Lauder Partners, LLC with the company's new owner assuring there is "solid financial footing." Perlman's continuance as CEO was revealed in a ...

date.headline: Slide Show: Highlights of Apple's first year without Steve Jobs
date.text: Slide Show: Highlights of Apple's first year without Steve Jobs

date.headline: Fired Apple worker sues, says Steve Jobs promised him job for life
date.text: A man who claims Steve Jobs told him he'd always have a job at Apple ( AAPL ) is now suing the company for firing him late last year.

date.headline: One Year of Tim Cook: Is He a Visionary or a Genius Executive?
date.text: One year ago today Steve Jobs stepped down as CEO of Apple anointing Tim Cook king of the iKingdom and by many metrics he has done a good job as leader of the gadgeteers. But, when Cook took the helm last August 24th, that wasn't the concern. Rather, the pundits wondered if Cook had a Steve Jobs-like vision that made the company so successful. From the New York Times' David Pogue, for example:

date.headline: Tim Cook Completes First Year as Apple CEO
date.text: On the anniversary of Steve Jobs' resignation we evaluate how his successor and the company are doing.

date.headline: GM's Opel may cut 30 percent of jobs in Germany: report
date.text: FRANKFURT (Reuters) - General Motors Co's ailing German unit Opel may have to cut a third of all jobs in the country, German newspaper Bild reported on Saturday citing a source. The person said Opel had agreed on a phased strategy with its parent General Motors that began by cutting the working hours of several thousand workers, a move announced earlier this week. The newspaper reported that GM ...

date.headline: Apple’s Tim Cook marks one year at the top
date.text: It’s been one year since Apple announced that Steve Jobs, the company’s co-founder, would resign from his position as chief executive, placing interim CEO Tim Cook into the job for good. Cook, of course, had been running the company for a while at that point while taking his third turn as Jobs’s stand-in while the famous executive was on medical leave. Jobs was to stay on as chairman. Read full ...

date.headline: Apple Delivers Crushing Blow to Google in Patent Dispute; Ghost of Steve Jobs?
date.text: Apple won a hard-fought moral victory and a $1 billion jury award in its high-stakes courtroom battle against Samsung Electronics for violating protected intellectual property. Samsung?s defense, partly funded by Google, could not counter Apple?s claims of patent infringements. Apple said it shouldered the development of the now common glass-faced smartphones
